![](http://elink.turing.ac.uk/o/4/eyJhaSI6NTkyMDc5NzIsImUiOiJ2aGVsbG9uQHR1cmluZy5hYy51ayIsInJpIjoiY29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0zYTFkNDdmZTNkOTQ0ZWE4YTExMDM5MTAwMTY0ODY4OSIsInJxIjoicDEtYjI0MDgyLTM0Mzc1OGU2ZGYxNzRjMWU5ZTQ1MTk4MDVkNjcyODlkIiwicGgiOm51bGx9/9TovxpnzFimcSKJ_Jj5kDQ)

Click [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fm%2F1%2F59207972%2Fp1-b24082-343758e6df174c1e9e4519805d67289d%2F1%2F32%2F3d9a2473-0380-43a6-88bf-365b9fe03512&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719822651%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=dDnT7khwZmzw%2FUkMFXJuJQqlLQlK9iXynBiUxxWuKDg%3D&reserved=0) if you are having trouble viewing this message.

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png)

This is March's Turing-Roche newsletter! Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and wider relevant networks.

Our [five year partnership](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FBkovSn3QSXmmaWlY-fxyhA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719822651%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=MjzRn%2FQ2GgRPyOZlEsmFTF0Yat7P%2Fo9kO%2Bv9PPV9JeI%3D&reserved=0) was officially launched in June 2021. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care.**

We are developing multiple research activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the broader community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at <vhellon@turing.ac.uk>

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fpx4AnrpCWuKdoGz6IFgv9Q&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719822651%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=HSUw%2Ft7esmbtenDAvXT0L8P1gbAa%2F3jOihDohoUJpv8%3D&reserved=0).

## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif)

### Partnership exhibits at AI UK- the UK's national showcase of data science and AI

Our partnership team were really excited to spend the first half of this week at AI UK, where we had an exhibition stand showcasing our research themes, outputs from our Community Scholars and also an interactive Pokemon themed demo, which took attendees on an interactive clinical journey to understand how clinical data is collected and combined in practice! You can also play the demo online [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FcvoaoxMQLBi-UgzGVIBsWA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719822651%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=4orVaE4V5HgcM50bhJAgfjGe6fFVGR9%2F3oNgUsohefc%3D&reserved=0).

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/pxl_20240319_092029735.mp-min.jpg)

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/pxl_20240319_122159839-min.jpg)

Our fantastic Theme Leads, Chris Banerji and Rohan Chakraborty also gave a lightning talk on 'Different flavours of AI Transparency for personalised healthcare' which will be available on the [Turing AI UK YouTube channel](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F_8WADMLQncre1UYltsW-yg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719822651%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=uNx57IL4v5Ebr8DLm%2Bag093EC57uwLbIQ0cdTasFDPM%3D&reserved=0) in the near future. 

Thank you to everyone who came and chatted with us, we hope to be at more conferences in the near future!

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/img-20240322-wa0000.jpg)

### Tech-Talk Event: Take your HPC Skills to the next level

**26 March 2024**

Run by our Turing-Roche Community Scholar, Ellen Visscher, the Tech-Talk series aims to facilitate the exchange of technical knowledge and skills between scientists in academia and industry.

Joining us for the second event in the series will be Svetlana Lyalina, Senior Safety Data Scientist in Product Development at Genentech (Roche). Svetlana will cover some intermediate-level tips and tricks for using high-performance computing (HPC) clusters, going beyond just logging in and submitting a simple job. 

More information on the event and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FXytYyZWXcgrvrSC0XOmNKw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719822651%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qPfJAi95LvjJdwAwL4t4IZI2lDfQ8DY6dunILafis0o%3D&reserved=0).

### New Theme Leads for the Partnership

The partnership is pleased to announce that Rohan Chakraborty and Chris Banerji will take up newly created positions of Theme Leads. They have been spear-heading the hands-on scientific developments for the partnership as Senior Research Associates till now, in addition to which, in their new leadership position as Theme Leads, will lead and mentor a high calibre group of postdoctoral researchers towards the fulfilment of the deliverables of the partnership through impactful cross-theme projects.

### New Partnership Publication: Charting cellular differentiation trajectories with Ricci flow

Our partnership team members Anthony Baptista, Chris Banerji and Ben MacArthur have a [new paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fs5QHKtE9ZCz2nDao5r9ICA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719978896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=P3xyFAFxOaceSjsDF7RldzaUnHTbFem%2FHGGMZQK%2BFa4%3D&reserved=0) 'Charting cellular differentiation trajectories with Ricci flow' published in Nature Communications. 

The paper details the development of new methods, using tools from geometry, to better understand tissue repair/regeneration and cancer development. These methods can allow us to better predict individual risk profiles and provide strategies for therapy, as well as being general enough to be applied to other opaque systems where explainability/interpretability is required.

Chris has also written an [accompanying blog](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_%2FT5_4tokNIhYlft3psMRbyg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719978896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=6PPLFDEJt5cM%2FTWyjY7QJt0QyXjJ2%2BqpyMJkbFGspNo%3D&reserved=0) which tells the history of geometry and how these approaches that were popularised in general relativity are now being utilised in cancer biology.

### Knowledge Share Series Event: Addressing Structured Missingness Challenges in Data Integration

**27 March 2024**

Join us for our monthly [partnership knowledge share series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FEdeIZu7jbNuakRM8cNYKTg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719978896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=EyY2EosKUjBjvH%2Br7c%2FU70q0NQzQZL36gM1oA3qqs1s%3D&reserved=0). Our aim is to bring together members of the Turing and Roche networks and the wider scientific community to hear partnership research updates and share different academic and industry perspectives on areas related to patient/treatment heterogeneity and data science more generally.

March's event is on the 27th and we will be hearing from Robin Mitra, Associate Professor of Statistics at UCL and Eleni-Rosalina (Elrozy) Andrinopoulou, Assistant Professor in Biostatistics at Erasmus MC, both part of the Structured Missingness Theme of the Turing-Roche Partnership. They will be discussing the issues with combining or integrating different data resources, through the lens of structured missing data with the case example of Cystic Fibrosis. You can register for the event [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWkxZnlIbHBMR0NCSUNCS28yeWh6c1NiNHRPZUFjZUlibHlVTDdtSHBVQ3dYcE1YbUwxNmJRZklBRlpjYVlYYUgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0zYTFkNDdmZTNkOTQ0ZWE4YTExMDM5MTAwMTY0ODY4OSZlc2lkPTgxMTI0MmQxLTMyZTEtZWUxMS05MDRjLTdjMWU1MjAyYmQ3YiJ9%2FDgmOOzXAkEycnFbuP1he2A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719978896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2Bz8IYjeq%2FNIYHyZFhnvaCvQhwEnsZP4QKuKDFVFoARQ%3D&reserved=0).

You can catch-up on previous recordings of our events at our [YouTube channel](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FBl3O4AM8KS5DYM5cvOR-iA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719978896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=jRVToFx%2B46Etic1EB%2FQzxGxU94IVWn80ZRhpQ1X8IVE%3D&reserved=0).

### New publications from our partnership Theme Leads

Alongside our new partnership publication (above), our partnership Theme Leads Rohan Chakraborty and Chris Banerji also have new papers out from their independent research.

Rohan's paper '[Uncertainty quantification of cuffless blood pressure estimation based on parameterized model evidential ensemble learning](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FtAmRzZIDi7_s0yHT7OpCyg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719978896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=osKnQbiM0eE6PKQ8LxwuuPWC6Uw1%2FRCdx3tmOI%2FNYA0%3D&reserved=0)' was published in Biomedical Signal Processing and Control with colleagues from the University of Electronic Science and Technology of China. The paper proposes a framework to reduce model uncertainty in cuffless blood pressure measurement, which has the potential to change detecting and preventing hypertension, but still has challenges around meeting clinical performance requirements. 

Chris's paper '[The DUX4--HIF1α Axis in Murine and Human Muscle Cells: A Link More Complex Than Expected](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FTnd4a9bWerResUmd9t50Pw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992719978896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=OUd4wD139GC6TVmN2VxAlZpD17UOOugwf6CPadqMwc0%3D&reserved=0)' was published in the International Journal of Molecular Sciences with colleagues from University of Mons and Kings College London. The paper explores the link between hypoxia response factor HIF1α and the DUX4 transcription factor in FacioScapuloHumeral muscular Dystrophy (FSHD). 

## Current News and Opportunities from The Alan Turing Institute and Roche

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/group_study_working__0.jpg)

### Turing Connections PhD Student Presentation and Networking Event- April 2024
**Registration deadline: 29 March 2024**

**Event: 26 April 2024**

As part of the 'Turing Connections' initiative, the Turing Institute is hosting a free event for PhD students across the UK. The event will feature student presentations, a networking session and complimentary lunch. Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F-L8OCQx3Be4ePAd3MZFOBA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720135190%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=i63A1DD8nt9vRxuSx1Ux85FHBndAax%2BGyIDylh94fV4%3D&reserved=0).

### Roche Student Internship- Green Computing at  Pharma Research & Early Development (pRED)

**Application deadline: 15 April 2024**

**Internship start date: 01 July 2024**

Applications are open to be a sustainability and innovation intern in the Predictive Modelling and Data Analytics group, part of pRED in Basel, Switzerland. Successful candidates will work on cutting-edge projects that align with Roche's commitment to environmental responsibility, social impact, and forward-thinking solutions. Find out more and apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FhhkRq1RHwQVAEY3uOoCVbg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720135190%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=3MJPpkNEfwAHcEZf%2BY37n8JnSkt0LSuVB27lLLiahf8%3D&reserved=0).

## Events

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/ags-0057_800-px-wide.jpg)

### Scottish AI Summit

**28 March 2024**

The Scottish AI Alliance is hosting the third Scottish AI Summit at Dynamic Earth in Edinburgh. The event will showcase Scotland's leading role in the development of trustworthy, ethical, and inclusive AI. The programme will consider questions such as 'Who should regulate AI?', 'When will we trust AI?' and 'Where are the diverse voices in AI?'. More info and registration [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWkxZnlIbHBMR0NCSUNCS28yeWh6c1NiNHRPZUFjZUlibHlVTDdtSHBVQ3dYcE1YbUwxNmJRZklBRlpjYVlYYUgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0zYTFkNDdmZTNkOTQ0ZWE4YTExMDM5MTAwMTY0ODY4OSZlc2lkPTgxMTI0MmQxLTMyZTEtZWUxMS05MDRjLTdjMWU1MjAyYmQ3YiJ9%2Fwkz2PgF7-pCUaC_oiViEzA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720135190%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Tb9lWS6TRNP79BJHHqSTrG5ukbS2lw1ObOXFiihYyjA%3D&reserved=0).

### Healthcare Text Analytics Conference (HealTAC 2024)

**Deadline for contributions: 28 March 2024**

**Conference: 12-14 June 2024**

HealTAC 2024 will be taking place in Lancaster, UK in June and will bring the academic, clinical, industrial, and patient communities together to discuss the current state of the art in processing healthcare free text and share experiences, results and challenges. 

They are also welcoming a variety of conference submissions such oral presentations, flash talks, posters, software demos and panel discussions. Further info on this and the conference [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FvuJR4sszpBiqyjHRPeXkTg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720135190%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=G99V%2FdE8BxQb2yLsd6eyI04h0pwkHb9iE5%2BLkaNwr1g%3D&reserved=0). 

### Health Data Research UK (HDR UK) Advanced Computer Science Summit: AI and Healthcare

**24 April 2024**

The HDR UK Advanced Computer Science Summit: AI and Healthcare aims to anticipate advances in technologies that are on the horizon and discuss the impact these may have on our research over the quinquennium. The event will take place from 10am-3.30pm and will feature a range of speakers giving their perspectives on the future of advanced computation in healthcare. Register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F5yMkX9RcVczrVOTZ1ZdSeQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720135190%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=P8B4l53NTZ4wSFikSED5hZqQG4q5Ap46vMujjMfDAJU%3D&reserved=0).

### The New Wave of AI in Healthcare Conference 2024

**01-02 May 2024**

In the rapidly evolving landscape of modern healthcare, novel digital health solutions featuring machine learning and AI tools are transforming research, diagnostics, therapeutics, and patient and healthcare provider experiences. Staying informed of the latest technological advances can be challenging due to the speed of innovation.

In collaboration with the New York Academy of Sciences, the Windreich Department of Artificial Intelligence and Human Health at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, this symposium will showcase the latest advances in AI- and data-driven technologies in healthcare. More info and registration [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWkxZnlIbHBMR0NCSUNCS28yeWh6c1NiNHRPZUFjZUlibHlVTDdtSHBVQ3dYcE1YbUwxNmJRZklBRlpjYVlYYUgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0zYTFkNDdmZTNkOTQ0ZWE4YTExMDM5MTAwMTY0ODY4OSZlc2lkPTgxMTI0MmQxLTMyZTEtZWUxMS05MDRjLTdjMWU1MjAyYmQ3YiJ9%2FK9NLfjR-KiQqei2yLOccuQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720291481%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=5qUaZinfI80kSlS34ziQdn1I5mXKRP72Aal0%2BheR%2FeA%3D&reserved=0).

### Health and Care Analytics Conference (HACA) 2024

**23-24 July 2024**

This year's HACA conference will be held on 23rd-24th July 2024 at Telford International Centre, with the opportunity to also attend virtually. It brings together analysts and leaders and decision makers to showcase how analysts can help leaders make high quality decisions. Further info on the conference and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fh9xYwvmGN1lpic1Ys4d1eQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720291481%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qr%2FRgOmixH7RmmYNbrpxn7GaN17Vt6tlie49qs8PYcU%3D&reserved=0).

## Other Opportunities
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/alex-shutin-204369-unsplash.jpg)

### Research Fellow Role in Generative AI in Health at UCL - Institute of Health Informatics

**Deadline: 29 March 2024**

The UCL Institute of Health Informatics is looking to appoint a Part time (0.50 FTE) Research Fellow in Generative AI in Health to join their welcoming and vibrant Institute.

The fellow will conduct research on text analytics and knowledge-driven methods, focusing on public health and healthcare datasets. Find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F1E-ho5renDauR0QR_Llf8A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720291481%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qwnP5nmXhYFebMw%2BDHXdy8M7l0U8%2FupSLfc2a0aOlYc%3D&reserved=0).

### Statisticians in the Pharmaceutical Industry (PSI) Training Course: Introduction to Machine Learning

**22-25 April 2024**

This course is aimed at clinical trial statisticians who are new to or with limited experience of machine learning. Featuring presenters form UCB and AstraZeneca, sessions will include ML foundation, supervised learning, model optimization and unsupervised learning and advanced topics (including neural networks, deep learning and large language models). Register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FU0WzAC4icr4byonYBlvmUw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720291481%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=VBLy515TmGSw6z9eODsAkYBfH%2F6Irz0BNDOPl51yZ7Q%3D&reserved=0).

### EPSRC Funding Opportunity: Transforming Prediction and Early Diagnosis in the Community

**Deadline for applications: 29 May 2024**

Apply for funding for research to develop novel tools and technologies for patient-specific prediction, early and accurate diagnosis of physical and mental health conditions for use in the community. The full economic cost (FEC) of your project can be up to £2,500,000. EPSRC will fund 80% of the FEC (up to £2,000,000). Projects can be up to 36 months. Find out more [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FdFl40S1wtlEhJ_EyuGq1Kw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720291481%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=6G%2B9tm5FEjvaGYqkhsfqx0iv2vIpdTP7Ltr45%2F1RIjU%3D&reserved=0).

## Featured Community Scholar of the Month
In September 2023 we welcomed our first cohort of Turing-Roche Community Scholars: 10 UK PhD students who are joining the partnership for a year to develop community-based projects for the partnership, alongside their ongoing PhD studies. Each month we are featuring a different scholar in our newsletter.

You can find out more about our community scholars [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FiGfd5qKepteLyjtqu0k53w&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720291481%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=IilCJnk%2BCgptf%2F97n45p619Cc%2FpIApvm0sSwHcgC2%2B4%3D&reserved=0). You can also see more about their plans for their projects [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FoVwOhPlf6o57APucWCbkSw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720291481%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=mMqwFEgHHcSu%2FLz40XFOsAwp4ePVVs5QWdNBKSXUkCo%3D&reserved=0).

This month's scholar is Jack Breen, from University of Leeds.

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/jack_breen.png)

**Tell us a little bit about yourself and your current research:**

I'm a PhD student in AI with a background in mathematics and statistics. My research concerns developing AI for ovarian cancer subtyping from histopathology images, with a focus on making more efficient methods to allow for clinical deployment.

AI in histopathology is a rapidly evolving field, and while some tools are starting to receive regulatory approval, they are still not being commonly applied in the clinic. No such tool has yet been approved for use in ovarian cancer despite this being the sixth most common cancer in women in the UK. We are aiming to develop algorithms to offer pathologists a second opinion in the diagnosis of ovarian cancer subtypes, which can be difficult and time-consuming to diagnose.

**What is your planned community scholar project? Why is this of interest to you? **

I am developing a chapter for The Turing Way research handbook about "Risks of Bias in Research". Risks of bias are the opportunities for reported results to become distorted by methodological limitations, and by identifying these risks we can ensure our research is accurate and impactful. I've been particularly interested in this line of work since I conducted a systematic review of AI in ovarian cancer diagnosis and found that nearly all the previous research had significant risks of bias, with many of these risks being possible to mitigate. I think many researchers are unwittingly reducing the impact of their research because they aren't aware of these issues, and I want to help address this.

**Where did you last go on holiday?**

I recently got back from Thailand so naturally, I need to tell everyone! I'd never been to Asia before and it was a fantastic experience, I just wish the weather had followed me home.

## Publication of the Month

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg)

**All models are wrong and yours are useless: making clinical prediction models impactful for patients**

This month's selected publication is [this paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWkxZnlIbHBMR0NCSUNCS28yeWh6c1NiNHRPZUFjZUlibHlVTDdtSHBVQ3dYcE1YbUwxNmJRZklBRlpjYVlYYUgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0zYTFkNDdmZTNkOTQ0ZWE4YTExMDM5MTAwMTY0ODY4OSZlc2lkPTgxMTI0MmQxLTMyZTEtZWUxMS05MDRjLTdjMWU1MjAyYmQ3YiJ9%2FeNNxVfT8wjis_-HaJNevNg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Ca80bad09ab154b250e5c08dc4a58d9e3%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638466992720291481%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=zsg5wISztHITTqYpJrbtEtdr46VDbrsR9Tp0dOr2y2A%3D&reserved=0), chosen by our featured Community Scholar Jack Breen. 

'This recently published comment article in npj Precision Oncology really resonated with me. In medical AI there's a huge disconnect between published research results and impact in the real world, and this short paper articulates the problem better than I had previously seen. It also lays out what we can do in academia to move closer towards the goal of clinical translation. The title was also perfectly provocative -- in statistics there is a saying that "All models are wrong, but some are useful", and I think this clever alteration is entirely justified considering the huge scale of academic research in medical AI which is not being implemented in the real world.'
